maml:description.maml:para: Backs up Intune App Configuration policies to a specified export path.

The Backup-EmMdmAppConfiguration cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune App Configuration policies, and exports them to the specified directory as JSON files. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API and includes confirmation prompts for actions with high impact.
The directory path where the App Configuration policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The directory path where the App Configuration policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a directory path as input.
[void] This cmdlet does not output any objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - New-EmMdmBackupDirectory

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmAppConfiguration -ExportPath "C:\Backup\AppConfigurations" This example connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune App Configuration policies, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\AppConfigurations" as JSON files.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = New-EmMdmGraphAuth -ClientSecretId "your-client-id" -ClientSecretTenantId "your-tenant-id" -ClientSecretValue "your-client-secret" PS> Backup-EmMdmAppConfiguration -ExportPath "C:\Backup\AppConfigurations" -AuthObject $authObject This example creates an authentication object using Client Secret authentication and uses it to connect to Microsoft Graph, retrieve Intune App Configuration policies, and export them to the specified directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Backs up Intune Device Compliance policies to a specified export path.

The Backup-EmMdmCompliance cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune Device Compliance policies, and exports them to the specified directory as JSON files. The cmdlet supports filtering policies by operating system and allows selecting between 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API. The cmdlet includes confirmation prompts for actions with high impact.
The directory path where the Device Compliance policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The operating system filter for the compliance policies. Valid values are "android", "iOS", "Win10", "macos", and "all". The default value is "all".
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The directory path where the Device Compliance policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The operating system filter for the compliance policies. Valid values are "android", "iOS", "Win10", "macos", and "all". The default value is "all".
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a directory path as input.
[string] This cmdlet returns the export path upon successful completion.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - New-EmMdmBackupDirectory

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmCompliance -ExportPath "C:\Backup\CompliancePolicies" -OperatingSystem "Win10" This example connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Windows 10 Device Compliance policies, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\CompliancePolicies" as JSON files.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmCompliance -ExportPath "C:\Backup\CompliancePolicies" -graphApiVersion "v1.0" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'v1.0' API version, retrieves all Device Compliance policies, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\CompliancePolicies" as JSON files.

maml:description.maml:para: Backs up Intune Device Configuration policies to a specified export path.

The Backup-EmMdmConfiguration cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune Device Configuration policies, and exports them to the specified directory as JSON files. The cmdlet supports filtering policies by device type and allows selecting between 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API. The cmdlet includes confirmation prompts for actions with high impact.

The device type filter for the configuration policies. Valid values are "windows81", "macOSExtensions", "macOSCustom", "macOSDeviceFeatures", "macOSGeneral", "macOSSoftwareUpdate", "macOSEndpointProtection", "androidWorkProfileGeneral", "androidWorkProfileVpn", "windowsHealthMonitoring", "windows81SCEP", "windows10Custom", "windows10EndpointProtection", "windows10General", and "all". The default value is "all".
The directory path where the Device Configuration policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

The device type filter for the configuration policies. Valid values are "windows81", "macOSExtensions", "macOSCustom", "macOSDeviceFeatures", "macOSGeneral", "macOSSoftwareUpdate", "macOSEndpointProtection", "androidWorkProfileGeneral", "androidWorkProfileVpn", "windowsHealthMonitoring", "windows81SCEP", "windows10Custom", "windows10EndpointProtection", "windows10General", and "all". The default value is "all".
The directory path where the Device Configuration policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a directory path as input.
[void] This cmdlet does not output any objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - New-EmMdmBackupDirectory

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmConfiguration -DeviceType "windows10General" -ExportPath "C:\Backup\DeviceConfigurations" This example connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Windows 10 General Device Configuration policies, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\DeviceConfigurations" as JSON files.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmConfiguration -DeviceType "all" -ExportPath "C:\Backup\DeviceConfigurations" -graphApiVersion "v1.0" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'v1.0' API version, retrieves all Device Configuration policies, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\DeviceConfigurations" as JSON files.

maml:description.maml:para: Backs up Intune Settings Catalog policies to a specified export path.

The Backup-EmMdmSettingsCatalog cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune Settings Catalog policies, and exports them to the specified directory as JSON files. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API and includes confirmation prompts for actions with high impact.
The directory path where the Settings Catalog policies will be exported. This parameter is mandatory.
The platform for which to retrieve policies. Valid values are "windows10" and "macOS". The default value is null, which retrieves policies for all platforms.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Backup-EmMdmSettingsCatalog -ExportPath "C:\Backup\SettingsCatalog" -Platform "windows10" This example connects to Microsoft Graph, retrieves Intune Settings Catalog policies for Windows 10, and exports them to the specified directory "C:\Backup\SettingsCatalog" as JSON files.

maml:description.maml:para: Compares two PowerShell classes and outputs their differences.

The Compare-EmMgClass cmdlet compares the properties and methods of two specified PowerShell classes. It outputs the differences between the classes, if any, or indicates if the classes are identical.
The first class to compare. This parameter is mandatory.
The second class to compare. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The first class to compare. This parameter is mandatory.
The second class to compare. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [Type] The cmdlet accepts two class types as input.
[string] The cmdlet outputs a string indicating whether the classes are different or identical.
It also outputs the specific property and method differences, if any.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the Compare-Object cmdlet to compare properties and methods of the specified classes.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Compare-EmMgClass -Class1 [ClassA] -Class2 [ClassB] This example compares ClassA and ClassB, outputting their differences in properties and methods.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a JSON string to a PowerShell class definition.

The Convert-EmMgJsonToClass cmdlet takes a JSON string and a class name as input and generates a PowerShell class definition. The cmdlet supports different operations (create, update, get) to customize the generated class properties and constructors.
The JSON string to be converted into a PowerShell class. This parameter is mandatory.
The name of the class to be generated. This parameter is mandatory.
The operation type to customize the generated class. Valid values are "create", "update", and "get". This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The JSON string to be converted into a PowerShell class. This parameter is mandatory.
The name of the class to be generated. This parameter is mandatory.
The operation type to customize the generated class. Valid values are "create", "update", and "get". This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a JSON string and a class name as input.
[string] The cmdlet outputs the generated PowerShell class definition as a string.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet generates a PowerShell class with properties, a default constructor, and a parameterized constructor based on the JSON string. The cmdlet uses different operations to customize the class properties and constructors.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $json = '{"name": "Test", "value": 123}' PS> Convert-EmMgJsonToClass -Json $json -ClassName "TestClass" -Operation "create" This example converts the JSON string into a PowerShell class named "TestClass" for the "create" operation.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a JSON string or file to a flat PowerShell object.

The Convert-EmMgJsonToFlatObject cmdlet takes a JSON string or a path to a JSON file and converts it into a flat PowerShell object. The cmdlet supports importing JSON from a file or directly from a string provided in the pipeline.
The path to the JSON file to be imported. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Import' parameter set.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The JSON string to be converted to a flat object. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'StringObject' parameter set.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The path to the JSON file to be imported. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'Import' parameter set.
The JSON string to be converted to a flat object. This parameter is mandatory when using the 'StringObject' parameter set.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a JSON string or a file path as input.
[PSCustomObject] The cmdlet outputs a flat PowerShell object.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the ConvertTo-FlatObject function to flatten the JSON structure. The cmdlet supports two parameter sets: 'Import' for importing JSON from a file and 'StringObject' for converting JSON strings. Borrowed private function code from: https://powersnippets.com/convertto-flatobject/

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Convert-EmMgJsonToFlatObject -ImportPath "C:\path\to\file.json" This example imports the JSON file from the specified path and converts it to a flat PowerShell object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: '{"name": "Test", "value": {"nested": 123}}' | Convert-EmMgJsonToFlatObject This example takes a JSON string from the pipeline, converts it to a flat PowerShell object, and outputs the result.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Intune App Configuration policies from Microsoft Graph.

The Get-EmMdmAppConfiguration cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph using the specified API version and retrieves Intune App Configuration policies. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. This cmdlet does not accept pipeline input.
[GetEmMdmTargetedManagedAppConfiguration[]] The cmdlet returns an array of Intune App Configuration policy objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - Connect-EmMdmGraph

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMdmAppConfiguration This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'beta' API version and retrieves Intune App Configuration policies.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMdmAppConfiguration -graphApiVersion "v1.0" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'v1.0' API version and retrieves Intune App Configuration policies.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Intune Device Compliance policies from Microsoft Graph.

The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMdmCompliance -OperatingSystem "android" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'beta' API version and retrieves Intune Device Compliance policies for Android devices.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an authentication object for connecting to Microsoft Graph using various authentication methods.

The Get-EmMdmGraphAuth function creates an authentication object that can be used to connect to Microsoft Graph. The function supports multiple authentication methods, including Client Secret, Certificate Thumbprint, Certificate Name, Managed Identity, System Assigned Identity, Access Token, Environment Variables, and X509 Certificate.
The Client ID for the application using Client Secret authentication. Mandatory for ClientSecret parameter set.
The Tenant ID for the application using Client Secret authentication. Mandatory for ClientSecret parameter set.
The Client Secret value for the application using Client Secret authentication. Mandatory for ClientSecret parameter set.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an authentication object for connecting to Microsoft Graph.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -ClientSecretId "your-client-id" -ClientSecretTenantId "your-tenant-id" -ClientSecretValue "your-client-secret" Creates an authentication object using Client Secret authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -CertificateThumbprintClientId "your-client-id" -CertificateThumbprintTenantId "your-tenant-id" -CertificateThumbprint "your-thumbprint" Creates an authentication object using Certificate Thumbprint authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -CertificateNameClientId "your-client-id" -CertificateNameTenantId "your-tenant-id" -CertificateName "your-certificatename" Creates an authentication object using Certificate Name authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -ManagedIdentity "your-client-id" Creates an authentication object using Managed Identity authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -SystemAssignedIdentity Creates an authentication object using System Assigned Identity authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -AccessToken (ConvertTo-SecureString -String "your-access-token" -AsPlainText -Force) Creates an authentication object using Access Token authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -EnvironmentVariable Creates an authentication object using Environment Variable authentication.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 8 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $authObject = Get-EmMdmGraphAuth -ClientId "your-client-id" -CertificateSubjectName "CN=YourCertificate" -CertificateThumbprint "your-thumbprint" -Certificate $certificate -TenantId "your-tenant-id" Creates an authentication object using X509 Certificate authentication.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Intune Device Update policies from Microsoft Graph.

The Get-EmMdmSoftwareUpdate cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph using the specified API version and retrieves Intune Device Update policies. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. This cmdlet does not accept pipeline input.
The cmdlet returns an array of PSCustomObject representing the Device Update policies.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - Connect-EmMdmGraph

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMdmSoftwareUpdate -graphApiVersion "beta" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'beta' API version and retrieves Intune Device Update policies.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMdmSoftwareUpdate -graphApiVersion "v1.0" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'v1.0' API version and retrieves Intune Device Update policies.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads the Microsoft Graph metadata XML file.

The Get-EmMgMetadataXml cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph using the specified API version and downloads the metadata XML file to the specified output path. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API.
The file path where the metadata XML file will be saved. This parameter is mandatory.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The file path where the metadata XML file will be saved. This parameter is mandatory.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. This cmdlet does not accept pipeline input.
The cmdlet outputs a message indicating the success or failure of the metadata XML download.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - Invoke-WebRequest

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgMetadataXml -OutputPath "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'beta' API version and downloads the metadata XML file to "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgMetadataXml -OutputPath "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml" -graphApiVersion "v1.0" This example connects to Microsoft Graph using the 'v1.0' API version and downloads the metadata XML file to "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml".

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves metadata information for a specific entity type from a Microsoft Graph metadata XML file.

The Get-EmMgMetadataXmlInfo cmdlet parses a Microsoft Graph metadata XML file and retrieves detailed information for a specified entity type. It gathers properties, methods, actions, enums, and relationships related to the entity type, and provides a JSON representation of the entity.
The file path to the Microsoft Graph metadata XML file. This parameter is mandatory.
The name of the entity type to retrieve information for. This parameter is mandatory.
The type of information to retrieve. Default is "EntityType".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The file path to the Microsoft Graph metadata XML file. This parameter is mandatory.
The name of the entity type to retrieve information for. This parameter is mandatory.
The type of information to retrieve. Default is "EntityType".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. This cmdlet does not accept pipeline input.
The cmdlet outputs a custom object containing detailed information about the specified entity type, including its properties, methods, actions, enums, relationships, and a JSON representation.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses XPath queries to navigate the metadata XML and extract relevant information.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgMetadataXmlInfo -XmlFilePath "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml" -TypeName "User" This example retrieves metadata information for the 'User' entity type from the specified Microsoft Graph metadata XML file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgMetadataXmlInfo -XmlFilePath "C:\GraphMetadata\metadata.xml" -TypeName "Device" This example retrieves metadata information for the 'Device' entity type from the specified Microsoft Graph metadata XML file.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves JSON resource and property information from Microsoft Graph API documentation.

The Get-EmMgResourceJson cmdlet fetches JSON resource data and property tables from specified OData types using Microsoft Graph API documentation hosted on GitHub. The cmdlet returns the JSON representation of the resource and its properties table.
An array of OData types for which to retrieve JSON resource data. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
An array of OData types for which to retrieve JSON resource data. This parameter is mandatory.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: The cmdlet accepts an array of OData types as input.
The cmdlet outputs a custom object containing the JSON representation and properties table of the specified OData types.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet constructs the URL to the Microsoft Graph API documentation for each specified OData type, downloads the markdown content, and parses the JSON resource data and properties table.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgResourceJson -ODataTypes "macOSExtensionsConfiguration", "windows81TrustedRootCertificate" This example retrieves JSON resource data and properties table for the specified OData types from Microsoft Graph API documentation.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves JSON examples for specified OData types and operations from Microsoft Graph API documentation.

The Get-EmMgResourceOperationJson cmdlet fetches JSON examples for specified OData types and operations (get, create, update) from the Microsoft Graph API documentation hosted on GitHub. The cmdlet returns JSON representations for the specified operations.
An array of OData types for which to retrieve JSON examples. This parameter is mandatory.
The operation type for which to retrieve JSON examples. Valid values are "get", "create", and "update". This parameter is mandatory.
The resource type for which to retrieve JSON examples. Valid values are "intune-deviceconfig" and "intune-mam". This parameter is mandatory.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
An array of OData types for which to retrieve JSON examples. This parameter is mandatory.
The operation type for which to retrieve JSON examples. Valid values are "get", "create", and "update". This parameter is mandatory.
The resource type for which to retrieve JSON examples. Valid values are "intune-deviceconfig" and "intune-mam". This parameter is mandatory.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: The cmdlet accepts an array of OData types as input.
The cmdlet outputs a custom object containing JSON examples for the specified OData types and operations.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet constructs the URL to the Microsoft Graph API documentation for each specified OData type and operation, downloads the markdown content, and parses the JSON examples.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-EmMgResourceOperationJson -ODataTypes "androidCompliancePolicy", "iosCompliancePolicy" -Operation "get" -Resource "intune-deviceconfig" This example retrieves JSON examples for the specified OData types and get operations from Microsoft Graph API documentation.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports Intune App Configuration policies from a specified JSON file.

The Import-EmMdmAppConfiguration cmdlet connects to Microsoft Graph, reads an Intune App Configuration policy from a specified JSON file, and creates the policy in Intune. The cmdlet supports both 'beta' and 'v1.0' versions of the Graph API and includes confirmation prompts for actions with high impact.
The file path to the JSON file containing the App Configuration policy to import. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The file path to the JSON file containing the App Configuration policy to import. This parameter is mandatory.
The authentication object used for connecting to Microsoft Graph.
The version of the Microsoft Graph API to use. Valid values are "beta" and "v1.0". The default value is "beta".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: [string] The cmdlet accepts a file path as input.
[string] The cmdlet outputs the ID of the created policy.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet uses the following functions: - Connect-EmMdmGraph

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-EmMdmAppConfiguration -ImportPath "C:\Backup\AppConfigurations\Policy.json" This example connects to Microsoft Graph, reads the App Configuration policy from the specified JSON file, and creates the policy in Intune.
